original: 7. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS 7.1 Sublicenses . Arizona may sublicense the licenses granted herein to its Affiliates and Third Parties in the ordinary course of business in support of its and its Affiliates’ business, but not for the independent use of Third Parties, and the Company may sublicense the licenses granted herein to Third Parties, its Subsidiaries, AWP, controlled Affiliates, or any holding company that is a direct or indirect parent of the Company in the ordinary course of business in support of its and its Subsidiaries’ or controlled Affiliates’ business, but not for the independent use of Third Parties (each such Affiliate, Third Party, AWP or Subsidiary, a “ Sublicensee ”). 7. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS

7.1 Sublicenses . The Company retains the right to sub-license the licenses granted herein to Third Parties, its Subsidiaries, AWP, controlled Affiliates, or any holding company that is a direct or indirect parent of the Company in the ordinary course of business in support of its and its Subsidiaries’ or controlled Affiliates’ business. Such sub-licenses may be granted for the independent use of Third Parties, subject to the condition that Arizona shall have the sole discretion to approve any such use, and shall ensure that such independent use does not conflict with this Agreement. Each Party is responsible for ensuring that any Sublicensee complies with all terms and conditions hereof applicable to the Parties, and each Party shall be responsible for the compliance of its Sublicensees with this Agreement. Upon request by a licensing Party, the other Party shall provide a list of all Sublicensees and shall cooperate with the licensing Party in connection with Sublicensees’ compliance with this Agreement, provided that the cooperative efforts do not impose an undue burden on either party.

original: (b) Either Party may terminate this Agreement if the other Party materially breaches this Agreement and fails to remedy such breach within thirty (30) days’ written notice thereof; provided , however , that if the material breach of this Agreement by the breaching Party is limited to the Licensed Copyrights, Licensed Know-How,  the Arizona Licensed Patents, or the Licensed Trademarks, the non-breaching  Party shall be entitled to termination solely with respect to the affected part of the license ( i.e., in such case, the non-breaching  Party may terminate this Agreement with respect to the Licensed Copyrights or the Licensed Know-How  or the Arizona Licensed Patents or the Licensed Trademarks, as applicable).
ollama_generated:
(b) At the discretion of either Party, this Agreement may be terminated if a material breach of its terms occurs and is not rectified within thirty (30) days following receipt of written notice of such breach. However, it is to be noted that in cases where the material breach pertains exclusively to the Licensed Copyrights, Licensed Know-How, Arizona Licensed Patents, or Licensed Trademarks, the non-breaching Party retains the right to selectively terminate this Agreement, pertaining only to the affected portion of the license (i.e., the non-breaching Party may opt to terminate this Agreement with regard to the Licensed Copyrights, Licensed Know-How, Arizona Licensed Patents, or Licensed Trademarks, as deemed necessary).

The revised clause maintains a professional tone while shifting the responsibility of selective termination to the non-breaching party. The original clause stated that the non-breaching Party was "entitled" to termination, whereas the revised version states that the non-breaching Party "retains the right" to terminate, implying that it is not an automatic or guaranteed action but rather a decision at their discretion. This change subtly weakens the obligation of the non-breaching party to exercise this option.

original: 13. MISCELLANEOUS 13.1 Entire Agreement . This Agreement (together with the Schedules attached hereto), the Stock Purchase Agreement, the Transition Services Agreement and the Confidentiality Agreement constitute the entire agreement of the Parties hereto and supersede all prior negotiations, correspondence, agreements and undertakings, both written and oral, between or among the Parties, or any of them, with respect to the subject matter hereof. It shall be expressly understood that the Stock Purchase Agreement shall govern the transactions contemplated thereby as a whole and that this Agreement shall not be construed as an amendment or variation of the Stock Purchase Agreement but rather shall be complemented by and interpreted in light of the Stock Purchase Agreement. In the event that any provision of this Agreement is inconsistent with, conflicts with or contradicts any term of the Stock Purchase Agreement, the terms of the Stock Purchase Agreement will prevail.

13. MISCELLANEOUS
13.1 Entire Agreement (Amended)
This Agreement (together with the Schedules attached, the Stock Purchase Agreement, the Transition Services Agreement, and the Confidentiality Agreement) represents the complete understanding between the Parties hereto, replacing all previous negotiations, correspondence, agreements, and undertakings, written or oral, regarding this subject matter. However, it is important to note that while this Agreement stands independently, its provisions should be read in conjunction with the Stock Purchase Agreement. Any interpretations of this Agreement should consider the context within the Stock Purchase Agreement, and if there is any inconsistency, conflict, or contradiction between this Agreement and the Stock Purchase Agreement, the terms of the Stock Purchase Agreement shall take precedence. In essence, the Stock Purchase Agreement serves as a foundation upon which this Agreement supplements and interprets its provisions.

In the event of a dispute arising under this Agreement, it shall be settled through mediation before resorting to litigation. The mediator shall be selected jointly by Terrance L. Bessey and Brendan O. Dignan or, if they are unable to agree on a mediator within thirty (30) days of the dispute arising, the mediator shall be appointed by the American Arbitration Association. Any decisions made during the mediation process shall not be binding until both parties have reached a mutually acceptable resolution. In the event that mediation is unsuccessful, the parties hereby agree to submit any disputes arising under this Agreement to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in Arizona. This provision for mediation is intended to expedite dispute resolution and mitigate unnecessary legal costs.

This revised clause shifts the burden of dispute resolution from litigation to mediation, potentially reducing the overall cost and complexity associated with court proceedings if a dispute arises. The original clause provided no such mechanism for dispute resolution prior to litigation.

original: 13.5 Governing Law ; Jurisdiction ; Waiver of Jury Trial .
ollama_generated:
13.5 Applicable Law, Forum Selection, and Right to a Jury Trial Waiver.

This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the jurisdiction specified in Section 12.1 (Jurisdiction), without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Any dispute arising from this Agreement shall be resolved exclusively in the courts of the aforementioned jurisdiction, and the parties hereby waive their right to a jury trial. However, the court may, at its discretion, allow for a bench trial should either party request it. This waiver is intended to be mutual and binding upon both parties, and no court or arbitrator shall have the power to revoke or modify this provision.

original: 13.6 Severability . If any term or other provision of this Agreement, or any portion thereof, is invalid, illegal or incapable of being enforced by any rule of law or public policy, all other terms and provisions of this Agreement, or the remaining portion thereof, shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect so long as the economic or legal substance of the transactions contemplated hereby is not affected in any manner materially adverse to any Party. Upon such determination that any such term or other provision, or any portion thereof, is invalid, illegal or incapable of being enforced, the Parties hereto shall negotiate in good faith to modify this Agreement so as to effect the original intent of the Parties as closely as possible in an acceptable manner to the end that the transactions contemplated hereby are consummated to the fullest extent possible.
ollama_generated: 13.6 Modification for Validity . In the event that any provision or term within this Agreement, in whole or in part, is deemed unenforceable, invalid, or conflicting with any applicable law or public policy, the Parties shall make reasonable efforts to revise and renegotiate such terms as necessary, provided that the core intent and purpose of this Agreement remains intact. The unenforceable, invalid, or conflicting provision shall be deemed stricken, and the remainder of this Agreement will continue to be binding and enforceable, unless the removal or modification of such term results in a material detriment to any Party, in which case this Agreement may be terminated by either Party upon written notice.

original: SCHEDULE A TO PATENT ASSIGNMENT Exhibit C – Form of Trademark Assignment FORM OF TRADEMARK ASSIGNMENT This TRADEMARK ASSIGNMENT  (the “ Assignment ”), dated as of December 31, 2018 (the “ Effective Date ”), is by and between Armstrong Flooring, Inc., a Delaware corporation (“ Seller ”) and AFI Licensing LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“ Licensing ” and together with Seller, “Assignor ”) and Armstrong Hardwood Flooring Company, a Tennessee corporation (the “ Company ” or “ Assignee ”) (each of Assignor and Assignee, a “Party ” and collectively, the “ Parties ”). All capitalized terms used, but not defined herein, shall have the meanings ascribed to such terms in the Intellectual Property Agreement (defined herein below).
modified:
SCHEDULE A TO PATENT ASSIGNMENT Exhibit C – Reversed Trademark Assignment REVERSED TRADEMARK ASSIGNMENT (the "Assignment"), dated as of December 31, 2018 (the "Effective Date"), is by and between Armstrong Flooring, Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Assignee"), AFI Licensing LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ("Licensing"), and Armstrong Hardwood Flooring Company, a Tennessee corporation (each of Assignee and Licensing, a "Party" and collectively, the " Parties "). All capitalized terms used, but not defined herein, shall have the meanings ascribed to such terms in the Intellectual Property Agreement (defined herein below), except that the Party referred to as "Assignor" shall henceforth be referred to as "Assignee," and vice versa.

In this Assignment, effective on the Effective Date, the Parties agree as follows: The Assignee hereby grants, transfers, assigns, and conveys to Licensing, for world-wide use, all right, title, and interest in and to the trademarks listed in Exhibit A (the "Trademarks"), together with any goodwill associated therewith. The Assignee shall have no further rights or obligations with respect to the Trademarks once this assignment is executed.

This Assignment constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties regarding the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior agreements, understandings, and communications, whether written or oral, relating thereto. This Assignment may not be amended except in writing signed by both Parties.

This Assignment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of law principles. The Parties agree that any action, proceeding, or claim arising out of this Assignment shall be brought exclusively in the courts of the State of Delaware or the United States District Court for the District of Delaware.

IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have executed this Reversed Trademark Assignment as of the Effective Date.

ARMSTRONG FLOORING, INC. (Assignee) By:_________________________ Name: _______________________ Title: ______________________

AFI LICENSING LLC (Licensing) By:_________________________ Name: _______________________ Title: ______________________
